scenarios.title: Corporate Burnout and Life Purpose

context.situation_background: Sarah has been working at a prestigious consulting firm for 5 years. She climbed the ladder quickly but now feels emotionally drained and questions whether this is what she truly wants to do with her life.
recent_events: Received a promotion with significant salary increase
Best friend left corporate world to start art therapy practice
Parents expressed pride in her success
Noticed she's been having trouble sleeping
client_concerns: Feeling ungrateful for complaining about success
Fear of disappointing family
Uncertainty about what would actually fulfill her
Financial security vs. personal happiness
hidden_factors: Deep creative side she's suppressed since college
Growing interest in helping others heal
Childhood dream of being a teacher
Fear of being seen as a failure

scenarios.primary_question: Everyone expects me to be grateful for my stable life, but I feel empty. Why?
followup_questions: Should I stay in my current job?
What would bring me more fulfillment?
How can I honor both security and happiness?
learning_objectives: Identifying core values and authentic desires

scenarios.title: Trust Issues After Betrayal

context.situation_background: Marcus discovered his partner of 3 years had been having an emotional affair with a coworker. They're trying to work through it in therapy, but Marcus struggles with rebuilding trust.
recent_events: Partner ended the emotional affair
Started couples counseling
Partner shared phone passwords
Marcus found himself checking up on partner constantly
client_concerns: Constant anxiety and suspicion
Feeling like he's becoming controlling
Uncertainty if love is enough
Fear of being hurt again
hidden_factors: Previous relationship ended due to infidelity
Struggles with self-worth
Difficulty expressing vulnerability
Pattern of pushing people away when hurt

scenarios.primary_question: Can I ever trust my partner again, or am I just setting myself up to be hurt?
followup_questions: How do I stop feeling so anxious all the time?
What do I need to heal?

scenarios.title: Empty Nest Syndrome

context.situation_background: Linda's youngest child just left for college. After 25 years of parenting being her primary identity, she feels lost and uncertain about who she is now.
recent_events: Youngest daughter moved to college dorm
Cleaned out daughter's room
Husband suggested they take a vacation
Old friend invited her to join book club
client_concerns: Feeling purposeless without children to care for
Marriage feels different after years of child-focused living
Doesn't remember what she enjoyed before kids
Worry about being seen as 'just a mom'
hidden_factors: Talented artist before having children
Always wanted to travel
Marriage has grown distant over the years
Pride in raising successful children

scenarios.primary_question: Now that my kids are grown, who am I supposed to be?
followup_questions: What should I focus on now?
How do I reconnect with my husband?

scenarios.title: Career Pivot vs. Graduate School

context.situation_background: Alex works in marketing but feels called to become a therapist. They've been accepted to a graduate program in counseling psychology but would need to quit their job and take on significant debt.
recent_events: Accepted to competitive graduate program
Received unexpected work bonus
Friend warned about therapist burnout
Volunteered at crisis hotline and loved it
client_concerns: Financial burden of graduate school
Starting over at age 30
Family thinks they're making a mistake
Uncertainty about being good at therapy
hidden_factors: Deep desire to help others heal
Natural empathy and listening skills
Fear of financial instability
Imposter syndrome about intelligence

scenarios.primary_question: Should I leave my stable marketing job to pursue graduate school in therapy?
followup_questions: Am I being realistic about the challenges?
What would I regret more - trying or not trying?
How can I make this decision with confidence?
learning_objectives: Exploring fears around change and risk

scenarios.title: Loss of Faith After Tragedy

context.situation_background: David lost his teenage son in a car accident 8 months ago. Previously deeply religious, he now questions everything he believed about God, meaning, and whether life has any purpose.
recent_events: Son's birthday passed recently
Stopped attending church
Wife suggests grief counseling
Found son's journal with plans for the future
client_concerns: Feeling abandoned by God
Anger at religious platitudes from others
Marriage strain due to different grief styles
Questioning if son's life had meaning
hidden_factors: Deep fear that death is truly the end
Guilt about moments of feeling normal
Spiritual experiences that contradict his doubt
Son shared his spiritual questioning before death

scenarios.primary_question: How can I believe in anything good when such terrible things happen to innocent people?
followup_questions: Will I ever feel whole again?
How do I honor his memory while moving forward?

scenarios.title: Debt and Self-Worth Spiral

context.situation_background: Maya graduated college with significant debt, works two jobs but still struggles financially. She's been using credit cards for basic necessities and feels overwhelmed by the mounting debt.
recent_events: Credit card was declined at grocery store
Saw friends posting vacation photos
Mom offered to help with money (pride says no)
Found a financial advisor willing to work with her
client_concerns: Feeling like a failure as an adult
Shame about needing help
Fear of never getting ahead
Comparison with more successful peers
hidden_factors: Excellent work ethic and problem-solving skills
Fear of being seen as a burden
Perfectionist tendencies that prevent asking for help
Strong values around financial independence

scenarios.primary_question: I feel like I'm drowning in debt. Does this mean I'm failing at life?
followup_questions: Should I accept help from my family?
How can I change my financial situation?
